items.title: The JS logo is 10 years old
items.content:
#â€‹558 â€” October 1, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A 'Self-Parking Car' in 500 Lines of Code â€” This is a fun one! Given a basic environment made up of virtual cars, can you train a genetic algorithm to have the cars park themselves? Yes. Hereâ€™s a liveÂ demo.

Oleksii Trekhleb

Bangle.js 2: The Open JavaScript Powered Smart Watch â€” Iâ€™m not a fan of linking to Kickstarters, but the creator of the Bangle watch â€“ for which you can develop apps in JavaScript â€“ delivered last time with v1 (Gordon Williams of Espruino fame, BTW), so maybe version 2 will appeal to you as it looks like a strong step forward. Conor Oâ€™Neill has written more about his impressions of the project and related workÂ soÂ far.

Kickstarter

â­ï¸ Professional JavaScript Learning Path â€” From JavaScript foundations, all the way to Hardcore Functional JavaScript, find out how far you can go with your JavaScript abilities in this comprehensive learningÂ path.

Frontend Masters sponsor

JSXGraph: Dynamic Mathematics Rendering with JS â€” A cross browser library for Web-based interactive geometry, function plotting, charting, and data visualization. Thereâ€™s a lot of examples, all complete with code. GitHubÂ repo.

JSXGraph team

7GUIs in JavaScript â€” A JavaScript variation of a GUI programming experiment where multiple apps are developed in multiple environments to compare the diversity of approaches. This is more interesting than it sounds, but shows off how frameworks like Vue or React help make more complex apps easier toÂ maintain.

Brad Woods

QUICK BITS:

  • The (unofficial, though by now de facto) JavaScript / JS logo is 10 years old! It was officially unveiled at JSConf EUÂ 2011.

  • Mike Sherov notes on Twitter that while jQuery eventually peaked in usage in 2020, it's still going strong and we owe the project a debt of gratitude.

  • The latest Safari Technology Preview has enabled support for SharedArrayBuffer.

  • The developer of Colorette, a terminal text coloring library, claimed his code had been improperly copied and rebranded into another library called nanocolors â€“ this led to a huge Hacker News discussion, an interesting Babel PR to replace chalk with nanocolors and Sindre Sorhus creating yoctocolors which boasts being even faster than nanocolors(!) ğŸ˜…

RELEASES:

react-pdf 5.4.0 â€“ React component to display PDFs.
Axios 0.22.0 â€“ Long standing HTTP request library.
ckeditor 30.0 â€“ Rich text editor framework.
Compressor.js 1.1 â€“ In-browser image compression.
Handsontable 10.0 â€“ Data grid component.
Node v14.18.0 (LTS)
eslint 8.0 RC0

ğŸ’» Jobs

Walmart is Hiring Software Engineers â€” Join a team delivering innovation at one of the largest retail and eCommerceÂ platforms.
Walmart Global Tech

Senior Frontend Engineer at UnifiHealth (Remote) â€” We're a seed-stage health insurance startup. Are you looking to have a big impact? Apply to be our first frontendÂ engineer.
UnifiHealth

Find a Job Through Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

Letâ€™s Dive Into Cypress For End-to-End Testing â€” The author tries to look for a fun and effective workflow to end-to-end testing withÂ Cypress.

Ramona Schwering

My Top Vue.js Interview Questions â€” â€œA list of Vue.js interview questions that I would askÂ candidatesâ€.

Michael Hoffmann

Sorting JavaScript Arrays by Nested Properties â€” Imagine you have an array of objects and you need to sort the data, but the items you need to sort are not all top-levelÂ properties...

Elijah Manor

How To Build an Interactive Dashboard â€” Learn how to build a sleek dashboard using the TileLayout. See all you can do with this deceptively simpleÂ component.

Progress KendoReact sponsor

Comparing Methods for Appending and Inserting with JavaScript â€” To the current pageâ€™s DOM, inÂ particular.

Eric Markfield

Three New Next.js Features and How to Use Them â€” AWS Amplify recently added support for incremental static regeneration (ISR) as well as optional catch-all routes and image optimization. This guide walks you through how to use itÂ all.

Ali Spittel

Faster React Apps with Memoization â€” You have a sluggish React web app on your hands. How do you fix it? Nick looks at resolving a problem with excessive re-renderingÂ here.

Nick Lanam

Explore JavaScript Dependencies with Lighthouse Treemap â€” Discover all JavaScript downloaded and used/unused for a site in a handy data visualization with LighthouseÂ Treemap.

Sia Karamalegos

All-Star Lineup Announced for Cloud Engineering Summit - Save YourÂ Seat â€” Hear from industry leaders and practitioners from Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Snowflake, Netflix, Docker, Twilio, andÂ more.

Pulumi sponsor

â–¶Â Â Single Page Application vs Multi Page Application with Rich Harris â€” A chat with the creator ofÂ Svelte.

Web Rush podcast

A JavaScript Developerâ€™s Guide to Browser Cookies
Prateek Surana

How to Implement Search Functionality in a Nuxt App with Algolia InstantSearch
Miracle Onyemna

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

PptxGenJS: Create PowerPoint Presentations with JavaScript â€” A huge amount of effort appears to have been put into this project with tutorials and demos aplenty. If you need to semi-automate creating slidedecks, itâ€™s well worth a look. GitHubÂ repo.

Brent Ely

melonJS 9.1.0: A Lightweight JavaScript and HTML5 Game Engine â€” Itâ€™s ten years old but still seeing releases. Hereâ€™s a look at how to build a platformer or a typing game withÂ it.

melonJS Team

Threads.js 1.7: Web Workers Meet Worker Threads â€” A library that provides an abstraction over both Web Workers and worker threads (as implemented in Node) to keep code consistent across Node, browser, and Electron. GitHubÂ repo.

Andy Wermke

Deliver Cleaner and Safer JavaScript Code - Right in Your IDE

SonarLint sponsor

DOCX 7.1: A Declarative API to Generate .docx Files â€” .docx files are perhaps more commonly known as modern Microsoft Word documents. This library works on both Node and the browser and thereâ€™s a live CodePen demo here, plus a folder of code examples. â€” GitHubÂ repo.

Dolan

construct-js: A Library for Creating Byte Level Data Structures â€” If you ever need to get down to the level of manipulating bits and bytes to build things, you might find this example of creating a .zip file directly in NodeÂ compelling.

Frank Stokes

RacketScript: An Experimental Racket to JS Compiler â€” Racket is a Scheme/Lisp inspired language. You can give it a try in this onlineÂ playground.

RacketScript

actions/github-script: Write Workflows Scripting the GitHub API in JavaScript
GitHub Actions

linq.js 4.0: A LINQ Implementation for JavaScript
Mihai Ciuraru

items.title: How to run third party scripts in a Web Worker
items.content:
#â€‹557 â€” September 24, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Partytown: Run Third-Party Scripts from a Web Worker â€” A clever (though experimental) library to let you relocate third party scripts into a Web Worker, yet the worker can perform synchronous main thread operations on the DOM using a rather clever mechanism.. or, as Rich Harris puts it, â€œtruly next-level mad scientistâ€ stuff. GitHubÂ repo.

Adam Bradley

You (Possibly) Don't Need Moment.js â€” Moment.js remains a popular date and time manipulation library but this repo shows off (a lot of) alternative approaches, including many native functions that do similarÂ things.

Various Contributors

Power Up Your JavaScript with Functional Programming â€” Learn core functional JS programming techniques by coding with pure functions, learning recursion, higher-order functions, closures, currying, function composition, andÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

A Look at 40+ Non-V8 JavaScript Implementations â€” With such a large number, youâ€™re not getting a lot of analysis, but itâ€™s neat to see just how many options and experiments there haveÂ been.

Phil Eaton

Introducing Gatsby 4: Now in Beta â€” Gatsby 4, the latest version of the popular React and GraphQL-based site generation framework, introduces new content rendering methods, new build and deployments architecture, new CMS APIs, andÂ more.

Gatsby Team

QUICK BITS:

  • The V8 9.5 branch has taken flight. What's new? Small things. Enhancements to Intl.DisplayNames and Intl.DateTimeFormat, and extended exception handling in WebAssembly.

  • A quick look at what's new in the Chrome 95 DevTools. Including, handily, historical bulletpoint roundups of older versions too.

  • ğŸ‘¾ Bomberland is a new Bomberman-themed AI dev competition and while it's language agnostic, there's a TypeScript based 'starter kit' if you want to dabble.

  • The latest version of Rollup, the module bundler, can output 'modern' ES code for more efficiency.

RELEASES:

Stimulus 3.0 â€“ HTML decoration oriented JS framework.
Meteor 2.4 â€“ Full-stack JS framework.
NeutralinoJS 2.8 â€“ X-platform desktop app framework. Now supports Raspberry Pi with a new 32 bit ARM port.
vuex-persistedstate 4.1 â€“ Persist state in Vue between page reloads.
Passport 0.5.0 â€“ Auth system for Node.js apps.
D3 v7.0.3 â€“ Popular data visualization framework.
Node.js 16.10.0

ğŸ’» Jobs

k6 Developer Advocate (Remote) â€” Weâ€™re looking for someone to engage the OSS community on performance & reliability, and to develop and maintain k6Â extensions.
K6 - A Grafana Labs Company

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

What's New in React 18? â€” A general roundup of whatâ€™s turning up in the next (not yet released) major version ofÂ React.

Yagmur Cetin Tas

â–¶Â Â A Live Look at Serverless Cloud â€” Jeremy Daly of Serverless Inc (and GM of Serverless Cloud, specifically) demonstrates the new platform live in person in a 50 minute session. A particularly useful and practical talk especially for JavaScript developers keen to give serverless aÂ try.

FooBar Serverless

[Guide] Ship Fast. Stay Ahead of the Competition â€” Intuit & Atlassian don't let process stand in their way. Learn their strategies to ship faster, safer & stayÂ ahead.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

â–¶Â Â From React to SvelteKit â€” The two hosts of the popular Syntax webdev podcast talk about moving a site from using React to SvelteKit and why it made sense. 55-minutes.

Syntax Podcast podcast

Rendering a Fourier Series Vizualisation with D3.js â€” A lovely little example complete with sourceÂ code.

Pierre Guilleminor

The Story of Five RCEs Found in npm for $15,000 â€” A security researcher explains some remote code execution vulnerabilities he found in the npm tool and how they added up to $15K inÂ payouts.

Robert Chen

Build a Mobile-Responsive Telehealth Pager App Using Streamâ€™s ChatÂ API

Stream sponsor

Index Signatures in TypeScript â€” Index signatures in TypeScript let you annotate objects of unknownÂ structure.

Dmitri Pavlutin

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Elk: A Low Footprint JavaScript Engine for Embedded Systems â€” A tiny embeddable engine that implements a subset of ES6 for use on microcontrollers (right down to 8-bit). Certainly makes a change from using C. Dual GPL or commercialÂ licensed.

Cesanta Software

Theatre.js: A JavaScript Motion Design for the Web â€” Can be used both programmatically and visually to animate 3D objects created with things like Three.js, HTML/SVG, and even just small page elements or JS variable values. Docs and GitHubÂ repo.

Theatre.js

Hotkey 1.5: Trigger an Action on an Element When a 'Hotkey' is Pressed â€” Use Hotkey, set the data-hotkey attribute on your elements, and you get keyboard shortcuts. GitHub built and uses it (look for the data-hotkey attributes on their pages). In the new 1.5 release you can define scoped hotkeys.

GitHub

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools for MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

Electron 15.0.0 Released â€” Following on rather quickly from v14, Electron is now on a new eight week release cadence. v15 of the popular cross-platform desktop app framework upgrade to Chromium 94, V8 9.4, and Node.js 16.5.0 â€“ none of which are huge advancements (though WebCodecs support may interest some), but itâ€™s always great to see how up to date Electron isÂ kept.

Sofia Nguy and Keeley Hammond

Code2flow: Generate Call Graphs for Dynamic Languages â€” Including JavaScript, Python, Ruby and PHP. Turns your source into ASTs, finds function definitions, where those functions are called, and turns that intoÂ diagrams.

Scott Rogowski

React Countup 6.0: Configurable React Component Wrapper around CountUp.js â€” For situations where you want a numeric value to count up from one value to another. Want the same thing without React? CountUp.js is forÂ you.

Glenn Reyes

nbb: Adhoc ClojureScript Scripting on Node.js â€” If you want to write ClojureScript and run it quickly on top of Node, this provides aÂ way.

Michiel Borkent

â€œThe purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it.â€

___
Pamela Zave

items.title: Quaking in our JavaScript boots
items.content:
#â€‹556 â€” September 17, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Q1K3: A JavaScript Homage to Quake in Just 13KB â€” Itâ€™s (another) quiet week for big JavaScript news, so weâ€™re going with the fun angle and looking at a popular entrant to the latest JS13KGames contest that ended this week. No winners yet but this Quake clone is amazing given the limitations, and takes me right back to 1996 when I installed it off a magazine cover disc (when the demo even then was 10Â megabytes).

Dominic Szablewski

ChowJS: An AOT JavaScript Engine for Game Consoles â€” Itâ€™s not every week we get to mention a new JavaScript engine. This post explains why another one is needed to run on gaming hardware in particular and how ChowJS fills a gap. Unfortunately itâ€™s not openÂ source.

Mathias KÃ¦rlev (MP2)

The Modern Guide to OAuth â€” Another OAuth Guide? Well yes, but... This guide covers all of the ways that FusionAuth actually uses OAuth. Become an expert without having to read all the specifications or write your own OAuth server. Get it for freeÂ today.

FusionAuth sponsor

Deno 1.14 Released â€” From engines and on to runtimes.. Deno has been making small but steady improvements over the past year and the latest point release is no different:

  • TypeScript 4.4 support, and V8 9.4.
  • Many Web Crypto API enhancements.
  • A new way to match URLs against patterns.
Hacker News had a nice little Deno discussion going on this week as well covering why people are using it, their experiences, etc.

The Deno Team

QUICK BITS:

  • The pipe operator (|>) proposal is coming along nicely.

  • Nuxt 3, the next version of the popular Vue framework, is coming in about 3Â weeks.

  • Fable 3.3, the latest version of a F# to JavaScript transpiler, is out with JS decorators support (though they don't compile to JS decorators, for reasons explained in the post).

  • Eric Elliott is back talking about software deadlines and recommends focusing on demos over deadlines.

RELEASES:

MUI 5.0 â€“ Material UI components for React.
jsPDF 2.4 â€“ Client side PDF generation library.
Node.js v16.9.1 â€“ Fixes a small V8 regression.
Kap 3.4.0 â€“ Screen recorder built with JS.
NVM for Windows 1.1.8 â€“ Node.js version management utility.
Espree 9.0 â€“ Pure JS JavaScript parser.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ jobâ€‘seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

How to Record Audio Using the MediaStream API â€” A practical introduction to using the Media Capture and Streams API to record audio from an end userâ€™s microphone then do something withÂ it.

Shahed Nasser

Small Bundles, Fast Pages: What To Do With Too MuchÂ JavaScript â€” The less JavaScript there is to run, the quicker it will run (you hope)! Bundle size matters and this post touches on a few ways to monitor and improveÂ it.

Ben Schwarz (Calibre)

Announcing JavaScript Security Sessions at SnykCon | Register ForÂ Free â€” Learn about malicious npm packages & npm dependency confusion attacks at SnykCon. Join us for free on OctÂ 5-7.

Snyk.io sponsor

An Intro to D3.js (Covering v5-v7) â€” A fork of Squareâ€™s Intro to D3.js introduction but updated to modern D3.js standards. Letâ€™s getÂ visualizing.

Danny Yang and Square

â–¶Â Â Fastify in One Minute â€” This isnâ€™t one of those ultra high level videos where you see nothing useful - itâ€™s fast paced and code-first, all in one minute. And it might convince you to give Fastify, a Node.js webapp library, a go for your next HTTPÂ API/webapp.

KapyDev

Using RTK Query in React Apps â€” Inspired by React Query, RTK Query lets you have similar functionality, but withÂ Redux.

Gurami Dagundaridze

Generating PDF from HTML in React: An Example of Exporting DataÂ Grids â€” Let's go deep into the PDF rendering labyrinth, in the safe hands of a guide, and export some advanced UIÂ components.

Progress KendoReact sponsor

Pre-Selling a Programming Course and Making $550k inÂ Revenue â€” If you liked the recent story about the creator of Vuetify making serious income from his efforts, maybe youâ€™ll enjoy that of Josh Comeau (the author of 'CSS for JavaScript Developers') too.

Failory

How to Automate UI Tests with GitHub Actions
Varun Vachhar (Storybook)

Handling Shadow DOM in Protractor Tests
Punit Goswami (Wingify)

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

JSPaint.exe: The Classic MS Paint as a Cross-Platform Native Desktop App â€” Based on the older JS Paint project then ported to a cross-platform app using GRaderJS (which is worth checking out on its ownÂ merits).

Dosyago Corp.

Linkify 3.0: Detect URLs and Email Addresses in Plain Text â€” Given some plain text containing things like links and emails, Linkify will generate the correct code to display it on the Web. Demo.

Hypercontext

Tasuku (ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯): A Minimal Task Runner for Node â€” Tasuku, which is simply Japanese for â€˜taskâ€™, provides a clean way to break up processes into small tasks which can then be run in the right order with progress displayed elegantly in the terminal. Check out the succinctÂ README.

hiroki osame

Observability Won't Replace Monitoring (Because It Shouldn't)

Lightstep sponsor

Lowdb 3.0: A Small Local JSON Database â€” Supports Node, Electron and the browser, and might be suited if you want a very lightweight data store you can query with pureÂ JS.

typicode

svg2pdf.js: Browser Based SVG to PDF Converter â€” Thereâ€™s an online playground to give you a feel for what it canÂ do.

yWorks GmbH

Atrament.js 2.0: A Library for Smooth Drawing on HTML Canvas
Jakub Fiala

Tethr: A Library Built on WebUSB for Controlling Digital Cameras
Baku éº¦

â€œI apologize for writing a complicated program. I didn't have time to write a simple one.â€

___
Tim SweeneyÂ (via Twitter)
items.contentSnippet:
#â€‹556 â€” September 17, 2021


UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  








  
  
Q1K3: A JavaScript Homage to Quake in Just 13KB â€” Itâ€™s (another) quiet week for big JavaScript news, so weâ€™re going with the fun angle and looking at a popular entrant to the latest JS13KGames contest that ended this week. No winners yet but this Quake clone is amazing given the limitations, and takes me right back to 1996 when I installed it off a magazine cover disc (when the demo even then was 10Â megabytes).
Dominic Szablewski 


  
  
ChowJS: An AOT JavaScript Engine for Game Consoles â€” Itâ€™s not every week we get to mention a new JavaScript engine. This post explains why another one is needed to run on gaming hardware in particular and how ChowJS fills a gap. Unfortunately itâ€™s not openÂ source.
Mathias KÃ¦rlev (MP2) 


  
  
The Modern Guide to OAuth â€” Another OAuth Guide? Well yes, but... This guide covers all of the ways that FusionAuth actually uses OAuth. Become an expert without having to read all the specifications or write your own OAuth server. Get it for freeÂ today.
FusionAuth sponsor


  
  
Deno 1.14 Released â€” From engines and on to runtimes.. Deno has been making small but steady improvements over the past year and the latest point release is no different:



TypeScript 4.4 support, and V8 9.4.
Many Web Crypto API enhancements.
A new way to match URLs against patterns.

items.title: What's new with all the DevTools?
items.content:
#â€‹555 â€” September 10, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

âœï¸ The hardest time of the year for putting a strong issue together is usually August, but this year the lull has moved to early September :-) No big news or releases this week, but lots of bits and pieces you'll hopefully findÂ useful.
__
Peter Cooper, your editor.

JavaScript Weekly

Bundling Non-JavaScript Resources â€” Learn how to import and bundle various types of assets from JavaScript in a way that works both with browsers andÂ bundlers.

Ingvar Stepanyan (Google)

Whatâ€™s New With DevTools: Cross-Browser Edition â€” Learn whatâ€™s new with the developer tools not just in Chrome, but in Firefox, Safari, and Edge too. One of those areas where just a little time spent becoming aware of the possibilities could shave off hours when it comes toÂ debugging(!)

Patrick Brosset

Locate and Resolve JavaScript Errors Instantly with Datadog â€” Troubleshoot user-facing incidents and resolve frontend JavaScript errors in context with the ability to correlate error logs with individual user sessions with one click. Try it yourself with a free DatadogÂ trial.

Datadog sponsor

Crafting Organic Patterns with Voronoi Tessellations â€” A fun look at creating interesting organic generative patterns inspired by the natural world. Generative art is such a fun use case forÂ JavaScript.

George Francis

Automatically Find jQuery Calls and Generate Vanilla JS Alternatives â€” The aim here is to provide a tool to help you remove jQuery as a dependency in projects by finding jQuery related methods and offering up â€˜vanillaâ€™ alternatives. Iâ€™m not entirely convinced, but itâ€™s an interesting idea. Alternatively, you could switch to a lighter, modern jQuery alternative like Cash.

Sachin Neravath

Node v16.9.0 Adds Package Manager Manager (sic) â€” A big addition is Corepack, a new experimental tool for managing package managers directly within the Node distribution itself (Yarn and pnpm are supported in addition to npm). V8 9.3 also makes an appearance.

MichaÃ«l Zasso

QUICK BITS:

  • The V8 9.4 branch has been created, but it's a relatively minor release with only static initialization blocks for classes being available by default as a new developer facing feature.

  • The folks at Amazon have launched the AWS Developers Podcast â€“ a weekly conversation about all things AWS, such as AWS Amplify with Ali Spittel.

  • Run npx matrix-rain for a nice terminal-based surprise. Code here (found via @boyney123).

  • The creator of Ruby on Rails has recorded a 15 minute screencast showing off how the popular backend framework will handle JavaScript in its next major version.

  • A fascinating OpenAI demo on using their system to write code from your directions. The first demo is in Python but jump to 13 minutes in and they build a basic game in JavaScript just by describing it.

Compete in 20 Hacking Challenges | Win Prizes | Free SnykConÂ CTF

Snyk.io sponsor

RELEASES:

Prettier 2.4 â€“ The opinionated code formatter.
React Router 5.3 â€“ Declarative routing for React.
Acorn 8.5 â€“ Small JS-powered JavaScript parser.
Flicking 4.3 â€“ Flexible carousel component.
ember-simple-auth 4.0 â€“ Auth for Ember.js apps.
Ember 3.28 and 4.0 beta â€“ Popular batteries included framework.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior Backend Engineer (Berlin / Remote) â€” Want to join a small startup with a big growing potential (we double every year)? Feather is looking for a backendÂ engineer.
Feather

Senior Software Engineer at Decisiv (ReactJS / Ruby on Rails) â€” Join our remote-first UI development team to help craft a modern platform that is revolutionizing anÂ industry.
Decisiv, Inc.

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

Exploring the CSS Paint API: Blob Animation â€” A fun effect currently supported only on Chrome (and Edge) for getting gooey/blobby shapes going with CSS enhanced by JavaScript via the PaintÂ API.

Temani Afif

What's New in Node.js Core? â€” Node updates so often that unless youâ€™re keeping a close eye on it (such as via our Node newsletter!) you can miss what new features got added. Simon shares a handful of useful additionsÂ here.

Simon Plenderleith

[Guide] Ship Fast. Stay Ahead of the Competition â€” Intuit & Atlassian don't let process stand in their way. Learn their strategies to ship faster, safer & stayÂ ahead.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

Using Neovim and Tmux for JavaScript Development â€” Are you a Vim user who, perhaps, migrated to VS Code but still feel a bit of an itch for the old days? Neovim, a fork of Vim, has really won Elijah over and here he demonstrates its value for JavaScriptÂ developers.

Elijah Manor

How An npm Package with 3M Weekly Downloads Had a Severe Vulnerability â€” Security researcher Ax Sharma has put together a good story about a significant vulnerability in pac-resolver.

Ars Technica

Threats of Using Regular Expressions in JavaScript â€” This is very elementary, but if youâ€™re unaware of what â€˜catastrophic backtrackingâ€™ is, it could beÂ illuminating.

Dulanka Karunasena

unknown vs any in TypeScript
Dmitri Pavlutin

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Shoelace: 'A Forward-Thinking Library of Web Components' â€” A collection of well designed every day UI components (buttons, drawers, inputs, menus, color pickers, and more) built in a framework agnostic way (though there are React wrappersÂ available).

Cory LaViska

Harlem 2.0: Simple Extensible State Management for Vue 3 â€” Provides a simple functional API for creating, reading, and mutating state - and itâ€™s only 1.5KBÂ minified.

Andrew Courtice

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools for MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

Renamer 4.0: Rename Files in Bulk â€” A Node powered CLI tool but with the interesting addition that you can write a replace function in JavaScript to perform more complexÂ renames.

Lloyd Brookes

Dannjs: A Neural Network Library for JavaScript â€” The aim is ease of use so itâ€™s good to use for experimentation and playingÂ around.

Matias Vazquez-Levi

gron: Make JSON Greppable â€” A tool written in Go that transforms JSON into more easily greppable assignments, so you can use grep and see the context/path of the result. Useful.

Tom Hudson

PrimeVue: A Vue UI Component Library â€” This is the Vue version of PrimeFaces, which also includes a React version. You can check out the Vue components here.

primefaces

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
